alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Furnas; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 12 at 1:49PM CDT until May 12 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN SMITH...PHILLIPS...WESTERN FRANKLIN...SOUTHERN PHELPS...SOUTHWESTERN KEARNEY...SOUTHEASTERN FURNAS AND HARLAN COUNTIES... At 148 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Atlanta to Alma to 7 miles north of Phillipsburg, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Atlanta and Huntley around 155 PM CDT. Ragan around 205 PM CDT. Wilcox, Republican City, Naponee and Harlan County Dam around 210 PM CDT. Hildreth around 215 PM CDT. Franklin and Bloomington around 220 PM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Hastings.
